intro: Anthadenia sesamoides, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, pungent scent when crushed.
